prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Trucy Wright
Description: A particular set of circumstances led to her being adopted by Mr. Wright. A world-class magician on the rise.
Character 1
Name: Athena Cykes
Description: The youngest lawyer in our agency. She apparently studied psychology in Europe.
Character 2
Name: Phoenix Wright
Description: My boss. He's taught me a lot about what it means to be a lawyer.
Character 3
Name: Bonny → Bonny de Famme
Description: A bunny-themed assistant who appeared onstage with Trucy.
Character 4
Name: Mr. Retinz → Roger Retinz
Description: A man somehow connected to the magic show. He showed up at the theater after the incident took place.
Character 5
Name: The Great Mr. Reus
Description: The victim in this case. A magician who took the stage with Trucy.
Character 6
Name: Ema Skye
Description: A detective. It looks like she finally became the forensic investigator she always wanted to be.
Character 7
Name: Nahyuta Sahdmadhi
Description: A prosecutor from Khura'in. He's also a monk, which explains why he's known as the "Last Rites Prosecutor."
Character 8
Name: Betty de Famme
Description: A magician who performed with Trucy. She is actually Bonny's twin sister.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: My beloved attorney's badge. Wearing it gets me raring to go.
The script has this to say about the fire trick: "This will be dangerous. Make sure the fire bucket is ready!"
Evidence 1
Name: Stage Diagram
Description: A diagram depicting the stage where the show was performed and the understage passage.
The script has this to say about the fire trick: "This will be dangerous. Make sure the fire bucket is ready!"
Evidence 2
Name: Crime Photo
Description: There are traces of blood in one of the coffin's holes. It's possible the blood was placed there after the fact.
The script has this to say about the fire trick: "This will be dangerous. Make sure the fire bucket is ready!"
Evidence 3
Name: Fingerprinting Results
Description: In addition to prints from the victim and Bonny, Betty de Famme's fingerprints were found on the top. There is no fingerprint evidence for Trucy Wright, however.
The script has this to say about the fire trick: "This will be dangerous. Make sure the fire bucket is ready!"
Evidence 4
Name: Fire Bucket
Description: A bucket to be used in case of fire. Not only was it empty, but dust lines the inside of the pail.
The script has this to say about the fire trick: "This will be dangerous. Make sure the fire bucket is ready!"
Evidence 5
Name: Gramarye Notebook
Description: The Troupe Gramarye creed, "A true entertainer always keeps a smile on their face," is written inside.
The script has this to say about the fire trick: "This will be dangerous. Make sure the fire bucket is ready!"
Evidence 6
Name: Thirteen-Year-Old Poster
Description: Mr. Reus was apparently ousted from Troupe Gramarye thirteen years ago due to an injury he sustained.
The script has this to say about the fire trick: "This will be dangerous. Make sure the fire bucket is ready!"
Evidence 7
Name: Show Script
Description: Bonny's script. The fire trick was canceled due to the incident. The script has this to say about the fire trick: "This will be dangerous. Make sure the fire bucket is ready!"
The script has this to say about the fire trick: "This will be dangerous. Make sure the fire bucket is ready!"
Evidence 8
Name: Contract
Description: A contract signed by Trucy herself. It details liability for compensation.
The script has this to say about the fire trick: "This will be dangerous. Make sure the fire bucket is ready!"
Evidence 9
Name: Trucy's Statement
Description: Trucy moved the stage lifts to cover for Bonny's mistake. She told no one about this.
The script has this to say about the fire trick: "This will be dangerous. Make sure the fire bucket is ready!"
Evidence 10
Name: Sword Stand
Description: Contains the rubber sword Trucy says she swapped in for the trick.
The script has this to say about the fire trick: "This will be dangerous. Make sure the fire bucket is ready!"
Evidence 11
Name: Stage Lift #2
Description: The stage lift Trucy had to move out of the way during the show since it was already all the way up.
The script has this to say about the fire trick: "This will be dangerous. Make sure the fire bucket is ready!"
Evidence 12
Name: Show Footage
Description: A disc with a recording of Trucy's escape trick on it.
The script has this to say about the fire trick: "This will be dangerous. Make sure the fire bucket is ready!"
Evidence 13
Name: Clipboard
Description: The clipboard used by Trucy to sign her contract. It was also instrumental in the Ratings Rajah's dishonest dealings.
The script has this to say about the fire trick: "This will be dangerous. Make sure the fire bucket is ready!"
Evidence 14
Name: Autopsy Report
Description: The victim's real name was Manov Mistree. His blood is on the murder weapon.
The script has this to say about the fire trick: "This will be dangerous. Make sure the fire bucket is ready!"
Evidence 15
Name: Prank Plan Script
Description: The corpse appearing and the set piece falling were staged by Roger Retinz.
The script has this to say about the fire trick: "This will be dangerous. Make sure the fire bucket is ready!"
Evidence 16
Name: Trucy's Note
Description: A note found in the dressing room after the incident that bears Trucy's signature. [caption] The note reads: "Bonny, Get the video camera after Mr. Reus comes tumbling out." The signature is exactly the same beyond human capability as that on Trucy's contract.
The script has this to say about the fire trick: "This will be dangerous. Make sure the fire bucket is ready!"

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: It's true. I had business in the understage passage because of the upcoming trick.
Person: Betty
Testimony 1
Testimony: It was the fire trick, right? The one Mr. Reus was supposed to do?
Person: Bonny
Testimony 2
Testimony: That's right. It's a very dangerous trick, so I had to make sure we were prepared for it.
Person: Betty
Testimony 3
Testimony: I-It was in the script... and I really wanted to see it... but I couldn't because of the accident.
Person: Bonny
Testimony 4
Testimony: Shut up! You're gonna give it away! ...Anyway, I was real busy.
Person: Betty
Testimony 5
Testimony: Yeah... Way too busy to have the chance to kill Mr. Reus...
Person: Bonny

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
response:
Okay, let's see. I need to find which evidence contradicts which testimony. Let's start by reviewing the testimonies and the evidences provided.

First, looking at the testimonies. Testimony 3 is from Bonny, saying: "I-It was in the script... and I really wanted to see it... but I couldn't because of the accident." The script here probably refers to the fire trick. So Bonny is stating that the fire trick was in the script, but she couldn't see it because of the accident.

Now looking at the evidences. Evidence 7 is the Show Script, which is Bonny's script. The description says that the fire trick was canceled due to the incident. The script's note about the fire trick is mentioned multiple times, and the fact that the fire trick was canceled would mean it wasn't actually performed. 

So if the script (Evidence 7) says the fire trick was canceled, but Bonny's testimony (Testimony 3) claims it was in the script and she wanted to see it but couldn't because of the accident, there's a contradiction here. Because if the script had the fire trick canceled, then it wouldn't have been part of the actual performance, so Bonny's statement that it was in the script and she wanted to see it might not align. Wait, no—the script originally had the fire trick, but it was canceled due to the incident. So maybe Bonny is referring to the script including the fire trick, which was then canceled. But the script's current state (as per Evidence 7) says the fire trick was canceled. So perhaps the contradiction is that Bonny says it was in the script and she wanted to see it, but the script now shows that the fire trick was canceled. Wait, but if the script originally included the fire trick but was canceled, then Bonny's statement could still be truthful. Hmm.

Alternatively, maybe looking at another contradiction. Let's check other testimonies and evidences. Testimony 5 from Bonny: "Yeah... Way too busy to have the chance to kill Mr. Reus..." But the fingerprinting results (Evidence 3) mention that Betty's fingerprints were found on the top (probably the coffin?), along with the victim and Bonny. But Trucy's prints are missing. However, this might not directly contradict Bonny's testimony about being busy. 

Another angle: Testimony 0 from Betty: "I had business in the understage passage because of the upcoming trick." The Stage Diagram (Evidence 1) shows the understage passage. But I need to see if any evidence contradicts this. Maybe Evidence 11 (Stage Lift #2) shows that Trucy had to move the lift because it was already up, which could relate to the understage passage. But not sure.

Wait, let's get back to Testimony 3 and Evidence 7. The Show Script (Evidence 7) states that the fire trick was canceled due to the incident. However, in Testimony 3, Bonny says "It was in the script... I really wanted to see it... but couldn't because of the accident." If the script had the fire trick but it was canceled, then maybe the fact that the fire bucket (Evidence 4) is empty and dusty indicates that they weren't prepared, contradicting the script's note to have the fire bucket ready. But the testimony here is about Bonny wanting to see it but couldn't due to the accident, which is the incident. Maybe the contradiction is that the script says the fire trick was canceled, so Bonny shouldn't have expected to see it. But if the script originally included it but was canceled, then Bonny's statement still makes sense. Hmm. Wait, the Show Script (Evidence 7) says the fire trick was canceled, so the script no longer includes it. But Bonny is saying that it was in the script. That would be a contradiction. Because if the script was modified to cancel the fire trick, then Bonny's script (Evidence 7) would not have the fire trick. But Bonny's testimony (Testimony 3) claims it was in the script. Therefore, that's a contradiction. So Evidence 7 (Show Script) contradicts Testimony 3 (Bonny's statement that the fire trick was in the script and she wanted to see it). Because the script now shows the fire trick was canceled, meaning it wasn't part of the actual performance. Therefore, Bonny's testimony that the fire trick was in the script would be false if the script was updated to remove it. But wait, the description of Evidence 7 says "Bonny's script. The fire trick was canceled due to the incident." So the original script might have included the fire trick, but after the incident, it was canceled. However, the testimony is from Bonny, who says "It was in the script... but I couldn't because of the accident." So maybe there's a discrepancy here. If the fire trick was canceled due to the incident, then the accident (which is the murder) caused the cancellation. But if Bonny is saying that the fire trick was in the script and she couldn't see it because of the accident, but the script itself was changed to cancel the trick because of the incident, which would mean that the script no longer includes the fire trick. Therefore, Bonny's statement that it was in the script would be contradicted by the current script (Evidence 7) showing it was canceled. Thus, the contradiction is between Evidence 7 and Testimony 3. So the correct answer is evidence 7 and testimony 3. Let me check again. Evidence 7 is the Show Script, which says the fire trick was canceled. Testimony 3 from Bonny says the fire trick was in the script. So the script as per evidence 7 no longer includes the fire trick (it was canceled), so Bonny's testimony that it was in the script is contradicted. Therefore, the pair is evidence 7 and testimony 3.

{"evidence": 7, "testimony": 3}
